I cannot predict the future or the limits of human ingenuity and innovation, and there is no clear answer to this question since building technology is always evolving. however, there are some factors that may restrict the height of buildings, for instance, limitations of the building materials, engineering constraints, and safety considerations.

tall buildings are also subject to deeper foundations, which require significant excavation and construction work that can make building higher floors more challenging and costlier. additionally, the safety of extremely tall buildings in extreme weather situations like hurricanes or earthquakes can also become more difficult as the buildings get taller.

but there are already skyscrapers that are over 800 meters tall, nearing or even exceeding a kilometer in height, so it is hard to predict what the limitations could be for building taller in the future. however, authorities should carefully evaluate the safety aspects and ensure that all safety measures are taken into account before any such buildings get constructed.
